Vocabularies.Definition: be good enough but not very good 过得去，尚可
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. My parents managed to get by on a small amount of money.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the state or an instance of being frustrated 挫折；令人失望
a. 郊外的，郊区的 suburb n. 郊区
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. His family lived in suburban London.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 满足，知足 e.g. He found contentment in reading novels.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 蜂蜜
be successful, fulfill the purpose 成功，达到目的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He made it after dozens of failures.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. go or travel in a canoe 划（或乘）独木舟 n. 独木舟 e.g. We were canoeing in the lake.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. move over snow on skis 滑雪
vi. glide or move along on skates 溜冰
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He loves roller skating.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 日落
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The fisherman set out at sunset for a night's fishing.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. （牛）哞哞叫
n. 鹰
n.  （单复同） 鹿
n. (AmE) 玉米田
vt. transport, as with a truck, cart, etc. （用卡车、马车等）搬运
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The farmers haul vegetables to the market on a truck every morning.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. wood used as fuel 木柴
n. 雪橇
vt. cover with tiles again 重新用瓦盖
a. 拖了很久的 overdue a. being sth. that should have occurred earlier 早该有的，早该发生的
n. the act or an instance of improving or being improved 改进，改善
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The government's priorities will go to local transport improvement projects.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 补充；增补
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The doctor suggested supplementing my diet with vitamins E and A.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  situated or used inside a building 室内的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Indoor pollution has been found to be as much as five to ten times higher inside some skyscrapers than outside.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. force out liquid in small drops upon 喷洒
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I'll have to spray the roses with insecticide to get rid of the greenfly.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 果园
n. 谷仓
n.  a young chicken 小鸡
n. 打字机
n. 自由撰稿人（或演员等） a. 自由撰稿人（或演员等）的 vi. 当自由撰稿人（或演员等）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Most of the journalists I know are freelance.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. strive to gain or accomplish 努力去获得（或完成），追求
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. After graduation Martin chose to pursue the same career as his father as a politician.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 家庭 a. 家庭的；普通的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The whole household was up early.

Vocabularies.Definition: (oversaw, overseen) vt. watch over or supervise 看管；监督
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. A special commission was set up to oversee the peace process.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 蜂窝，蜂箱
n. 风琴；器官
vt. make into a pile 将……堆起来 n. 一堆
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Once the last few people had left the hall, the caretakers began stacking the chairs.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. evil or bad 邪恶的；坏的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I would rather starve in a ditch than accept the fortune upon such wicked terms.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. flow or run over the top or banks 溢出，泛滥
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The river was overflowing.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. flood, overwhelm by an excess of sth. 淹没；压倒
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. A big wave swamped the boat.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  冰柜，冷藏室；（冰箱中的）冷冻室
n. 樱桃
n. 悬钩子，树莓
n.  芦笋
n. 豆；豆形果实
n. goods preserved in a can 罐装品
n.  食橱；碗橱
n. 李子，梅子
n. 果子冻
(pl squash or squashes) n. 南瓜属植物（如南瓜、倭瓜、笋瓜等）
n. 南瓜
come successfully to the end 通过，度过
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The local government has taken some measures to ensure that all the people will get through the winter.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 加仑（液量单位，美制等于3.785升，英制等于4.546升）
at that very moment, right then 就在那时
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The train was now only a couple of yards from the kids on the track. At that point, Anthony threw himself forward and pulled them clear.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. definitely, undoubtedly 肯定地，无疑地
vt. invoke divine favor upon 为...祝福 blessing n. 祝福；鼓励
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Bless you, my boy.

Vocabularies.Definition: with all things considered 总的来说
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I think, on balance, I didn't treat you unfairly.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the home of a wild animal 兽穴
vt.  provide with visual features; clarify by use of examples, etc. 加插图于；举例说明
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Let me use another example to illustrate this difficult point.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  harness (a draft animal or team) 用挽具套住
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He hitched the horse's rope over the pole.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a sled pulled by one or more dogs 狗拉雪橇
n. an animal of strange or terrifying shape 怪物，妖怪
n. a short account of written materials or data 文摘；摘要 vt. 消化；融会贯通
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. A digest of the findings of the research has been made available to the press.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. sth. that indicates or fixes a limit or extent 边界；分界线
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The river is the boundary between the two countries.

Vocabularies.Definition: wilderness n. 荒野，荒地 wilderness area (AmE) an often large tract of public land maintained essentially in its natural state （保持自然生态的）公共荒野保护区
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He is proud of the garden he made from a wilderness.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. bring into existence, produce 形成，产生
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The widespread use of Spanish in some American cities has generated a public debate over language use in the country.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  of, relating to, or for the teeth 牙的，和牙有关的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. You can get free dental treatment.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 保险；保险费
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Many nations have some form of compulsory unemployment insurance.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 保险单，保险契约；政策
n. 费
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He hadn't paid his television license fee.

Vocabularies.Definition: be ready to pay 付（帐）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. If he loses the case, Michael will have to pick up the bill for legal costs.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. lesser or smaller in amount or importance, etc. 较少的，较小的，较次要的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. They only encountered minor problems in their first space flight.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 保险费；奖金，奖品
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The employers make the employees pay for a large portion of their health insurance premium.

Vocabularies.Definition: except for; in addition to 除了；除……以外（尚有）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Aside from an occasional game of tennis, he doesn't take any exercise.

Vocabularies.Definition: reduce in size or amount 减少，削减 e.g. There is a growing movement to cut back the government's role in agriculture and to reduce subsidies paid to farmers.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. to an extent that can be noticed or considered important 能够感到地；可观地
v. make or become smaller in amount, degree, etc. 降低
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Increasing your intake of fruits and vegetables can lower your risk of getting some types of cancer.

Vocabularies.Definition: eat a meal away from home 外出吃饭
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. It's Jane's birthday today, so we're dining out tonight at a special little restaurant we know.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. go to as a customer 光顾，惠顾
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. They no longer patronize the local department store because of its poor service.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 芭蕾舞（剧）
a. spending much more than necessary 奢侈的，浪费的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She's very extravagant -- she spends all her money on clothes.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. believe to be true, likely or probable; feel doubt about 不相信；怀疑
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I have no reason to suspect her honesty.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the state or quality of being alone or remote from others 孤独，独居
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He enjoyed his moments of solitude before the pressures of the day began.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  预算
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. This year's budget for AIDS prevention probably won't be much higher.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 要求；必备条件
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Patience is definitely a requirement for a career in teaching.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a relative level or degree 规模 on a small/ large scale 小（大）规模地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We tested our new teaching methods on a small scale. Indeed only six classes were involved in it.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. keep from giving in to or enjoying 抵制
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We couldn't resist laughing at him in those funny clothes.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 诱惑（物）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. In my view students should resist the temptation to take part-time jobs in their first two years at college.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a piece of equipment designed to serve a special purpose 设备，装置
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. For consumers without access to PCs, intelligent set-top（机顶的）devices will be their guide to digital photography.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （总称） 机器，机械
n. 马力
a. turning on an axis 旋转的
n.  a machine for loosening the soil and destroying weeds 耕耘机 rotary cultivator 旋转式耕耘机
n. an advantageous gain or return 得益；收益, 利润 v. 获利，得益；有益于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The tax is likely to hit his company's profits by up to 3 per cent in future.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. commit (money or capital) in order to gain a financial return 投资
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We have invested most of the money in shares in British companies.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. mainly, originally 主要地；起初
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We are primarily concerned with improving our working conditions.
